page.title: 10BARLEY MALTING
page.content: On the larger farm an old tythe barn has been adapted to fit the needs of a modern farm by a corrugated iron addition and the installation of a drier. Before the grain can be stored it is dropped into a pit,goes through a pre-cleaner that gets rid of large and small refuse,then goes on either to a final cleaner or through the drier.This can handle 7 tonnes an hour.The crop has to be harvested in good condition and a critical temperature of 13 degrees centigrade must be maintained for barley otherwise malting will fail.Inside the barn there are 4 separate sections 3 used for storage and 1 for machinery. Storage is important because this farmer holds grain until he can get the best price.Modern additions to the old timber structure have caused problems.
